question.body: Why are most bones composed of both spongy and compact bone?

multiple_choice.choice: Spongy bone reduces weight and brittleness; compact bone adds stiffness.
Spongy bone reduces brittleness; compact bone reduces weight and adds stiffness.
Spongy bone adds weight; compact bone reduces brittleness.
Spongy bone reduces weight; compact bone reduces brittleness.

response.feedback: Correct. The trabeculae of spongy bone reduce weight and reduce brittleness; the osteons of compact bone add stiffness.
Incorrect. The trabeculae of spongy bone do reduce brittleness; but the osteons of compact bone add weight.
Incorrect. The trabeculae of spongy bones reduce weight; the osteons of compact bone increase brittleness.
Incorrect. The trabeculae of spongy bones do reduce weight; but the osteons of compact bone increase brittleness.
